ralgorithm

Class ExpandedOneTunnel

  • java.lang.Object
    • ralgorithm.ExpandedOneTunnel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Movement

    public class ExpandedOneTunnel
extends java.lang.Object
implements Movement
    The OneTunnel is the most primitive kTunnel from Start to End in one turn. This implementation is the expanded verion of the move, run on exapnded modules

    The OneTunnel is the building block for more complex kTunnels, which are effectively a series of 1-Tunnels.

    Visual Aid: Modules are labeled with either a letter or number. Where A, B, C are the modules being 1-tunneled.

    START
      6
    0 A5
    1 B4
      23

    END
    0 65
    1 AB4
      23

    Requirements:

    • 0 exists iff 1 exists
    • 2 exists iff 3 exists
    • Robot must be expanded and all modules expanded at start of movement

    Invarients:

    • Module A will always be connected to Module 6
    • Module C will always be connected to Module 4
    • Connectedness will be maintained throughout the 1-tunnel between modules 0, 1, 2, 3, 5
    Since:
    2/14/2016

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExpandedOneTunnel

        public ExpandedOneTunnel(Robot r,
                         Module m,
                         int dir,
                         int pushDir)
        Instantiate an ExpandedOneTunnel movement in a simple form of which Module being tunneled

        Tunnels around a Turning module, which is at the corner or only turn

        Parameters:
        r - the Robot to tunnel through
        m - Module right next to the Turning module which will be pushed in
        dir - First direction of tunnel (to mush m in)
        pushDir - Second direction of tunnel (push Turning module out)

    • Method Detail

      • initFromCoordsWithDir

        public static ExpandedOneTunnel initFromCoordsWithDir(Robot r,
                                                      int dir,
                                                      Coordinate start,
                                                      Coordinate end)
        initializes a move given two coordinates and a direction to start the tunnel, the second direction is inferred from the supplied direction.

        This function does not make the assumption that both the start and end coordinates must be leaf nodes in the robot connection tree.

        Parameters:
        r - Robot to initalize the move on
        dir - initial direction of movement of module at start coordinate
        start - coordinate of module to be "moved" to end position
        end - coordinate of module to be "moved" to

      • initFromCoords

        public static ExpandedOneTunnel initFromCoords(Robot r,
                                               Coordinate start,
                                               Coordinate end)
        Initializes a 1-tunnel move from a start coordinate to an end coordinate in the module graph.

        To figure out the actual tunnel position, we rely on the fact that the start node is a leaf node, and therefore only has a single neighbor direction which we use to determine the tunnel path of the 2 possiblities.

        Parameters:
        r - Robot tunneling through
        start - The starting location of the tunneling Module in r (x,y) where y+ is up and x+ is right
        end - Final location, where the module is tunneling to
